meanings.definition: A Jewish lesson or lecture on religious texts.
meanings.sent1: During the shiur, the rabbi explained the Torah.
meanings.sent2: I attended a shiur on the history of Judaism.
meanings.sent3: The shiur about the Ten Commandments was both informative and engaging.
meanings.sent4: Her shiur on the prophets was like a light shining on ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The shiur left a lasting impression on the students.

meanings.sent1: He needed a shiur of flour for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter measured the wood with a shiur.
meanings.sent3: The shiur of sugar in the bowl was too much for the cake.
meanings.sent4: The shiur of water in the glass was just right for her thirst.
meanings.sent5: She poured a shiur of oil into the pan.

meanings.definition: A portion or share of something.
meanings.sent1: Each person received a shiur of the profits.
meanings.sent2: He took a shiur of the cake for himself.
meanings.sent3: The shiur of the inheritance caused some disagreements.
meanings.sent4: She gave a shiur of her time to volunteer at the shelter.
meanings.sent5: The shiur of the treasure was enough to change their lives.
